title: How Will Junglers Fair With The Health Potion Price Increase?
body: So if the price of {{item:2003}}  Health Pots is going up, how will Junglers manage their first clear? You would only be able to afford 1 pot after your {{item:1039}}  Hunter's Machete, and some Champs need that extra potion. If I'm understanding this right, any Jungler without good early sustain or good clear *cough* {{champion:28}} *cough*  will be nerfed hardcore. They already made early jungling harder this season, now next season it'll be even harder?

replies.body: Junglers will have a few options. Starting gold's 500, Hunter's Machete costs 350g (as does Hunter's Talisman, an alternate jungle starting item that gives mana and health regen instead of damage on hit and lifesteal). That then leaves 150g which is enough for either 3 health pots or the new mini flask. That's got 2 charges, each of which restores 100 health, at a cost of 150g. It upgrades (combine cost 250g) into a bigger refillable potion called Hunter's Potion, that holds 5 charges of 60 health/35 mana and gains a charge whenever you kill a large jungle monster.

I guess this is why kindred was given god like sustain

This is probably not it honestly. Adcs have never been great junglers due to their lack of sustain, slow clear time early, and lack of gank potential. The only adc that could really jungle before kindred was Twitch, and that was before his (first) rework.

I think the sustain was given to kindred to help ensure they would actually be used in the jungle.

But you cannot deny with the new changes coming up riot probably didn't implement  that much sustain just for jungle?  Well yes ust for jungle... but.. that they perhaps knew the changes coming and were like "Well with the new changes coming she's gonna need good sustain or the jungle will be harsh on her when we change it, better to make her a little strong now then to buff her later"

The comments made by meddler and the other reds seem to go against that actually. They are toning down early jungle damage while also still making it so you can afford more health potions than before.

The way Kindred is designed with their marking and sustain is supposed to reinforce the idea that they are supposed to be a jungle champion. They may have the changes in mind, but I don't think the sustain was put there strictly because of the preseason changes.

Also, to those talking about other adc jungles (twitch and quinn respectively), yes you can still jungle them. I have before, it can be fun. I've even done well as them. That doesn't mean they are designed to jungle, nor are they really good at it. Take Twitch. Yes he can gank. But his sustain in the jungle is awful, and his clear time is dreadfully slow. Anyone who can jungle half way decently will see a twitch, and know to just counter jungle him. He has no dueling power (especially early in that first jungle clear!) abd he has no escapes.

The way you need to look at it is this. Yes I can pick this champion for X role. By what about them makes me want to play them there instead of just using Y champion who can do the same things but better? It's why malzihar ad might be a thing in normals, but you will almost never see it in ranked. Same goes for a lot of the other off the cuff roles.
